The case for API Platforms

(8) Side Effects of Accidental Platforms

  • Lack of governance
  • Lack of insights
  • Ineffective development practices
  • Lack of collaboration

Platform Success Factors

Platform Success Factors Erik Wilde: How hard can it be?
The case for API Platforms

(14) Full Lifecycle Support

  • Support from initial design to decommissioning
  • Larger set of tools than in the traditional platform model
  • The tooling landscape [https://tools.openapis.org/] is constantly evolving


Platform Success Factors Erik Wilde: How hard can it be?
The case for API Platforms

(15) Self-Service: Platform as a Product

  • Approaching platform management with the users in mind
  • Creating and managing a backlog
  • Focus on ease of use and Developer Experience (DX)


Platform Success Factors Erik Wilde: How hard can it be?
The case for API Platforms

(16) Participation and Collaboration

  • Support the sequence of innovation, adoption, and productization
  • Support the discovery and consumption of capabilities
  • Support the production and publication of capabilities


Platform Success Factors Erik Wilde: How hard can it be?
The case for API Platforms

(17) (Some) Platform Success Factors

  1. Support the entire software development lifecycle
  2. Provide support that scales and is easy to consume
  3. Support discovery and collaboration across teams


API Management with API Platforms

Outline (API Management with API Platforms)

API Management with API Platforms Erik Wilde: How hard can it be?
The case for API Platforms

(19) From Plumbing to Strategy

  1. Fix the security issues of open APIs
  2. Provide a governance structure for all APIs
  3. Expose all APIs for easy discovery and use
  4. Make API platform part of the development platform


API Management with API Platforms Erik Wilde: How hard can it be?
The case for API Platforms
